abstract: Reeling from losses in subprime mortgages, the banking giant is moving its chief to Hong Kong and seeking growth in China and other emerging markets.
snippet: Reeling from losses in subprime mortgages, the banking giant is moving its chief to Hong Kong and seeking growth in China and other emerging markets.
lead_paragraph: HSBC is so tied to Hong Kong that when the bank’s shares dropped sharply earlier this year a local television commentator burst into tears while reporting the news.

headline.main: HSBC Returns to Its Roots in Hong Kong
headline.print_headline: Bank Returns To Its Roots In Hong Kong

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

byline.original: By Julia Werdigier and Landon Thomas Jr
